missions.name: Harmonics
missions.summary: Contractors track down and destroy communication jamming equipment that is hampering CT operations

briefing.old:
**Harmonics** **Employer**
Gunzkili National Police **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Militia & Terrorist Cell
Disrupt communications and operations

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors, Gunzkili National Police

INDEPENDENT FORCES:
Local Police

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
Civilians may be present outside of cities, although the rural areas are unsafe and civilians are unlikely to stray far from major centers.

TERRAIN CONSIDERATIONS:
Very flat, swamps. **Mission**
A terror cell has been deploying jammers for military radio, cellphones, and Wifi devices throughout the region in an attempt to disrupt the National Police Counter-Terrorism Unit's ability to receive civilian reports and respond.

We have been tasked with tracking down nefarious devices causing interference.
It is recommended to have EOD on this mission.
We have aquired Spectrum Devices that can detect a wide range of frequencies, and help determine their location.

A list of common frequencies ranges has been provided.

Note: Contact DLC is required to use the Spectrum Device.

Primary Objectives:
- 2x Area of reported Cellphone jamming (Purple)
- 1x Area of reported Wifi / Bluetooth jamming (Yellow)
- Unknown count of military radio jammers

Second Objectives:
- Engage any threats encountered near civilian locations

missions.name: Ol' Bandits
missions.summary: A train carrying a small shipment of NATO supplies hasn't arrived at its destination.

briefing.old:
**Ol' Bandits** **Employer**
NATO Joint Task Force in Czechia **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Unknown

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors, NATO Joint Task Force in Czechia

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
There will be civilians in the area. **Mission**
A train with a small amount of NATO supplies was on its way to the NATO controlled airport, but never arrived. It was reported as passing through Sušice at 1134, but never reported as passing through Žichovice.
Locate the supplies and return them to the NATO controlled airport.

missions.name: Options
missions.summary: Contractors support the HIL in hunting down a powerful crime leader.

briefing.old:
**Options** **Employer**
Suursaari Government **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Local Militia, supporting Stefanos Mastori

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors, Horizon Islands Legion **Mission**
The island of Suursaari is in chaos. A powerful man named Stefanos Mastori has been running organized crime on the islands for years, and has had a lot of control.

However, The Suursaari Government has desperately been trying to get rid of him, and recently made a deal with the Horizon Islands.
The Horizon Islands will get a 60 year lease to the isalnd of Säyvö, in exchange for HIL forces being deployed to Suursaari to help the government secure control and capture Mastori.
HIL forces have are in the process, but are being met with resistance from local militia.
The Horizon Islands Government only approved a deployment of 40 HIL members to the island, so the HIL has hired Synixe Contractors to help them.

Mastori has been seen leaving Suurkylä, and is believed to be hiding to the south. The HIL believe he has an extraction team en route, but do not know where they are coming from, or when they will arrive.
The HIL have secured all major towns, and have a helicopter with radar and thermal imaging to help them find Mastori.
Our task is to move in on foot and find Mastori, and capture him.

missions.name: Origins
missions.summary: Synixe Contractors remove mortar positions on a small island

briefing.old:
**Origins** **Employer**
Sahrani Military **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Local Insurgents

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
Small town on the island, civilians are present **Mission**
We are tasked with destroying mortar sites being used to hit the edges of Sahrani mainland territory.

There may be support forces on the island, we should remove any additional threats on the island.

We have been provided with a small boat for transport.

missions.name: Pikavaellus
missions.summary: Synixe Contractors secure plans for a possible attack on a new NATO base in Finland

briefing.old:
**Pikavaellus** **Employer**
Finnish Government **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Anti-NATO Militia

FRIENDLY FORCES:
None

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
Civilians are present, and may relay information to enemy forces. **Mission**
A group of Anti-NATO militiamen are planning an operation against a newly setup joint NATO base in Finland.
Not wanting to involve NATO forces in a domestic issue so early into the new partnership, the Finnish government has hired Synixe Contractors to deal with the threat.

Finnish Inteligence services have provided us with three locations on an island where the militia is known to operate from. An insider has said that they have split some of their plans onto 4 yellow flashdrives.
The data has been sharded, and each flashdrive contains only a part of the plans. We need to find all 4 flashdrives to decode the plans, if don't secure all 4, they will not be able to decode the plans.
We will be inserting and extracting via boat, and will not have access to our vehicles.

missions.name: Ransom Intervention
missions.summary: Contractors must work quickly to save a local businessman from a group looking to make a quick buck.

briefing.old:
**Ransom Intervention** **Employer**
Alcot Insurance, Ruha Police **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Unknown

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
Civilians are present near the area of operations. **Mission**
A polish businessman named Krzysztof Eberhardt has been kidnapped by an unknown group of individuals. We have been hired by his insurance company to negotiate for his release, or recover him by force if necessary.

We have been given a location to meet the kidnappers. We are to meet them at the location, and attempt to negotiate for his release.

They have set the ransom at $2 million. Once we have Mr. Eberhardt, we are to bring him to the airport for extraction.

If safe to do so, we are to attempt to recover the ransom money as well and prevent the kidnappers from escaping with it.

missions.name: River Duty
missions.summary: Contractors investigate bomb threats against a dam, several bridges, and industrial facilities during a local festival.

briefing.mission:
We have been contracted to prevent attacks on critical infrastructure that may occur
during the annual Mayson Festival.

The region around the city of Kinney has seen a recent increase in industrial activity.
The area has had a healthy logging industry for many years, but recently a larger
gas and oil industry has begun to take hold. Some of the local residents have
expressed concern about the environmental impact of the new industry, but the
city insists that the new industry will bring jobs and prosperity to the area.

A group of environmentalists, have taken up against the new industry.

A local law expanding the rights of the companies to use public land for their
operations has been met with growing protests from the environmentalists.

The group has not been violent in the past, but they have been known to trespass,
vandalize, and harass executives of the new companies. The group has been
growing in size.

The environmental protesters have not been known to be violent, and we believe that
the majority of the protesters will not be violent. However, we have received intelligence
that a small group is planning to cause damage to industrial sites, bridges in the
area, and most dangerously, the dam.

The city officials have decided to continue with the festival, and want to avoid
further upsetting their citizens. They have asked us to keep a low profile, and
to avoid using lethal force unless absolutely necessary.
briefing.objectives: PRIMARY Investigate the threats against the bridges, industrial sites, and dam SECONDARY Maintain the peace around the festival and your work sites Prevent other actions by the environmentalists if learned of RESTRICTIONS Do not use lethal force unless absolutely necessary Keep weapons on your back, holstered, or in vehicles as much as possible while working around civilians. Maintain a low profile.
briefing.situation:
<font color='#e3d310'>EMPLOYER</font>
Name: Lybor Regional Development Board
Location: Kinney Town Hall

Have been working to change the regional laws to allow the new industry to
operate in the area. They have been a target of the environmentalists' protests.

<font color='#d81717'>ENEMY FORCES</font>
Name: Unknown Threat Makers

Threatened to disrupt the Mayson Festival, and use explosives to destroy
bridges and industrial equipment in the area.

<font color='#1d69f6'>FRIENDLY FORCES</font>
Name: Kinney Police Department
Location: Kinney, deployed throughout the region for the festival

Using marked police vehicles, and wearing police uniforms. Generally unarmed.
Will be focused on festival security.

<font color='#139120'>INDEPENDENT FORCES</font>
Name: Agve Security
Location: Industrial sites throughout the region

Security clothing, unmarked. Unarmed.
Conducting standard security operations at the industrial sites.
Will allow Synixe Contractors and Kinney Police to operate on the sites.

<font color='#993399'>CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS</font>
Name: Environmental Protesters

Possibly present at the festival, and at the industrial sites.

Name: Festival Attendees

Will be present at the festival and nearby towns.
May be driving, hiking, boating, camping, or otherwise enjoying the area.

**Shoulders** **Employer**

missions.name: Walk Him Out
missions.summary: Contractors must secure and extract David Morely after a resort town was raided.

briefing.old:
**Walk Him Out** **Employer**
David Morely **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Local Militia, known to operate near coastal towns for shipments in and out of the island

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors

INDEPENDENT FORCES:
Pulua Security Forces

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
Civilians may be present in some towns, but unlikely to still be near the AO **Mission**
An American man named David Morely was temporarily residing in Pulau, in the resort town of Nirwana. Last night the town was raided by local militia, and David was taken hostage. The small Pulau Security Forces are unable to mount a rescue operation, and associates of David have hired Synixe to rescue him.

Primary Objectives
- Secure Mr. Morely's laptop from his house in Nirwana or the local militia
- Secure David Morely and bring him to Synixe's FOB

Secondary Objectives
- Secure David's Laptop from his house in Nirwana or the local militia

missions.name: Needle in a Haystack
missions.summary: Contractors Locate and destroy a weapons shipment

briefing.old:
**Needle in a Haystack** **Employer**
NATO **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Takistani Militia


FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors




CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
Confirmed by NATO surveilance that their are no civilians in the area.

TERRAIN CONSIDERATIONS:
Mountains and height differentiation everywhere. Only one road leading to the other side of mountains. **Mission**
With the fall of Aziz, the Takistani Militia has grown ten fold due to his cult-like followers. Deep in the Takistani Mountains, The militia has just recieved a weapons shipment presumably to arm their new soldiers. The exact location of the shipment is unknown. However, we know the weapons will be inside a Praga V3S REARM or REFUEL Truck. Destroying it or capturing it will surely lower the enemy's morale and have others lose faith in their cause.

A replica of the truck you are looking for has been parked at your FOB for reference, although their are many duplicates rumoured in the AO. Youll know you found the primary objective due to the sheer amount of weapons and ammunition inside. Furthermore, the truck itself will be guarded by a small team, no larger than 5 or 6. Surveillance shows almost every town to be heavily guarded, along with enemy technicals patrolling the area so plan your routes accordingly. Most importantly, their is one singular road leading in and out of the takistani mountains. With this being the enemy's only way to get supplies in and out, it is sure to be heavily fortified. God speed and Good Luck Gentleman!

Primary Objective: Secure the weapons truck and bring it back to FOB. If unable to, destroy the weapons truck instead.

missions.name: Eyes in the Sky
missions.summary: Contractors secure the crash site of a US drone.

briefing.old:
**Eyes in the Sky** **Employer**
United States Government **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Takistani Army
The Takistani Army is expected to engage any western forces on sight.

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors

INDEPENDENT FORCES:
Takistani Local Militia
Takistan has many tribal militias that do not align with either the Takistani army nor western forces. Mostly confined to mountain camps, they will defend themselves if they feel threatened.

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
There are many civilians going about their day within the greater Takistan region. However, there should be limited amounts of civilians in the town of Nur due to it being taken over by the Takistani army.

TERRAIN CONSIDERATIONS:
Mostly bare mountains with sparse vegetation and rocks. **Mission**
After the assassination of a high ranking Takistani general in January of 2030, US-Takistani relations began to severly degrade. In the following months, resentment grew among Takistan against the United States and other 'terrorist' nations allied with them.

Looking to gain intel on the brewing Takistani army, the US decided to deploy one of its new stealth drones in the region.

At some point along the drone's flight path, it suffered an unknown malfunction and contact was lost. It is highly unlikely that Takistani forces brought it down, due to their outdated equipment. Based on the flight path and last known position, the US believes the drone crashed somewhere near the Takistani border village of Nur.

Since the United States is to have no official presence in Takistan, we have been contracted to secure the crash site. Since it will be impossible to recover the drone in a timely manner, we have been ordered to destroy it. Secondarily, we are to recover any sensitive data the Takistani Army may have extracted (electronics/documents).

Based on what recon the drone gathered before it was lost, the Takistan Army has only just entered the AO, with the majority of forces concentrated near the town of Rasman and the nearby airfield. A couple of Takistani fortifications were spotted in the town of Nur, however their presence has surely only increased since the crash.

missions.name: Two Betrayals
missions.summary: Contractors assist the FIA in an assault.

briefing.old:
**Two Betrayals** **Employer**
British Government **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
AAF
The AAF occupy the entire island. Based on the recent flashpoint, AAF is expected for fire at any FIA or NATO aligned forces on sight. It is recommended to avoid main roads and settlements.

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors
FIA

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
While civilians are still present on Altis, civilian presence in the AO should be practically nonexistent.

TERRAIN CONSIDERATIONS:
Low mountain ranges, patches of forest, and moderate morning fog. **Mission**
For the greater part of a year, FIA forces on Altis have been skirmishing with the AAF in the absence of NATO's presence. Since the NATO pull out, various NATO states have been trying to gather intel on the conflict.

For some time, the British government had an informant on the island named Giorgos Elias. Giorgos Elias defected from the AAF and joined the FIA 8 months ago. For approxiamately 6 months, he had been in contact with the British government, providing periodic updates on the situation.

A vital asset for both the British and the FIA, Giorgos Elias has apparently decided to defect back to the AAF, trading his knowledge for protection.

The FIA have determined that Giorgos Elias is being held in northwestern Altis. While the FIA are not sure of Giorgos Elias' exact whereabouts, the AAF occupy both Oreokastro and the nearby castle. As such, the FIA are preparing an assault on the two locations.

The British government has contracted us to assist in this planned assault. They have already coordinated with the FIA and locals to insert us on to the island.

We will move to grid 041202 to meet the local FIA section leader and get briefed on the planned assault. When ready, we will use the laptop to signal the beginning of the assault. If we take too long, the FIA will not wait and will commence the attack by 0530.

We will assist in the assaults, searcing for Giorgos Elias. However, the FIA has made it clear that if they find Giorgos Elias, they plan on executing him for treason. Secretly, the British government wants us to capture him alive and extract him. As such, it is vital that we reach him before the FIA does.

When we find and secure Giorgos Elias, we are to immediately exfiltrate. We have no obligation to help the FIA once the target is secure.

missions.name: Uncontrolled Det
missions.summary: Contractors are tasked with dealing with an unexpected explosive threat.

briefing.old:
**Uncontrolled Det** **Employer**
Daltgreen Mining and Exploration Ltd. **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Local Insurgents
Insurgents are known to attack mining sites, alongside planting explosives and mines in known supply routes. They are known to kidnap personnel and execute VIP representatives.

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors
NATO
United Assistance (UNA)

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
Civilians are present in the region, they may or may not be supportive of our involvement.
UNA has one facility in the area. **Mission**
Sometime last night, a bomb was brought onto the premises of Daltgreen's train yard at grid 035944. The bomb went unnoticed for most of the day until a Daltgreen employee decided to investigate a suspicious, empty Daltgreen marked vehicle. There, the employee discovered a large bomb sitting in the bed of the truck and Daltgreen immediately contacted us for disposal. Dealing with this threat is our initial tasking.

The bomb is situated near important infrastructure (silos/train tracks) and, as such, Daltgreen will not allow us to do controlled detonation on the premises. Any bombs or bomb components must be defused. Any remaining explosive material (including disarmed bombs) will need to be taken offsite and safely disposed of, as they don't want any explosive material falling into the wrong hands. Daltgreen has advised us that the old quarry to the west at grid 020945 would be an ideal location to safely detonate any remaining explosives. If necessary, the Daltgreen truck itself can be driven offsite and destroyed.

Security camera footage from the previous night shows the bomb being driven on site in a Daltgreen cargo truck by a Daltgreen employee. Based on the number of the truck and the time of the incident, Daltgreen suspects their employee Theodoros Manetta was the driver. Currently, Daltgreen is unsure of his whereabouts.

Daltgreen has tasked us with finding and detaining Theodoros Manetta. We are to search his worker place of residence at grid 044923 for any clues as to his whereabouts or his motives. Daltgreen suspects he is still within the region as he has no contacts outside the company.

Once Theodoros Manetta has been apprehended, we are to deliver him to Daltgreen at the train yard. Daltgreen will take over from there.

missions.name: Ground Traffic Control
missions.summary: Contractors identify and arrest a controversial figure in the Airport of Tanoa for extraction.

briefing.old:
**Ground Traffic Control** **Employer**
Winston Ba, from the Inner Circle organization. **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Not specified in the contract.

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors, Gendarmerie, Inner Circle

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
Civilians will be present in the region, and a few will be arriving at the airport's arrivals.
**Mission**
Contractors have been hired to arrest a controversial figure in Tanoa, known as Markos Savala.

Officially, contractors will be holding security at the Aeroport de Tanoa to arrest any 'suspicious arrivals'. However, this is a cover disguise for the unofficial operation.

Unofficially, we have been contracted to arrest Markos Savala. He will be arriving in one of the flights arriving at Aeroport de Tanoa. He can be identified by his formal dress code, as he will be wearing a suit, and any further personal identification methods.

Contractors will hold and maintain security at the Aeroport de Tanoa, keeping its premises safe. Weapons should be kept lowered and on safety unless a direct threat is spotted. Contractors are NOT allowed to enter the hangars, runways, nor disturb air traffic nor the airport's inner operations. They are to avoid disturbing civilians and gendarmerie, and must not, under any circumstances, disclose their actual intent nearby Gendarmie personnel.

Once Markos Savala is identified, contractors will promptly arrest him, and escort him to 081097 Keypad 9 by the local church, where he will be handed off to the Inner Circle organization.

Contractors are not to approach the Inner Circle without having arrested Markos Savala.

Markos Savala will be handed off to the Inner Circle's representative, Winston Ba, who can be identified by his red beret, once Markos Savala has been handed off, contract is complete.

missions.name: In The Air Tonight
missions.summary: Amidst a tug of war between multiple factions for control over Chernarus, contractors must find and locate an important weapon smuggler in the region.

briefing.old:
**In The Air Tonight** **Employer**
Chernarus Government **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Chernarussian Army of the Red Star (ChDKZ)
The ChDKZ are known to take over large barns and farming compounds to turn them into their strongholds, they are very hostile towards the CDF, unsupporting locals, and any western-aligned forces.

FRIENDLY FORCES:
The National Part of Chernarus (NAPA) is friendly to contractors, as they want to get rid of the ChDKZ presence and influence on their country by any means possible.

INDEPENDENT FORCES:
The Chernarussian Defence Force (CDF) is neutral to contractors, additionally, they are unaware of their presence and intentions in the country. It is best to avoid them.

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
There are civilians present in the area of operations, they may or may not be in support of either ChDKZ, NAPA, CDF, or contractors.

TERRAIN CONSIDERATIONS:
Extensive mountain ranges, various elevation changes, and dense forests. **Mission**
Contractors have been reached out by Chernarus in an extended effort to find and track down weapons and supply smuggling in the northwestern region of Chernarus.

A head of the ChDKZ known as Dima Sejkora is believed to be one of the main key elements of the weapon smuggling line, as such, contractors have been tasked to find him and execute a kill or capture order.

We do not have any further information on his whereabouts or how to identify him, however, what we do know, is that he is somewhere in the designated area of operations and we believe he has links with some of the local ChDKZ cells.

Contractors have been hired to eliminate any ChDKZ in the area and to collect any intelligence that could lead to Dima Sejkora's location, and subsequently put an end to his terrorism.

missions.name: Intervention
missions.summary: Contractors secure POWs for the CDF.

briefing.old:
**Intervention** **Employer**
Chernarus Ministry of Defence **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Chernarussian Movement of the Red Star
The ChDKZ have been at war with the CDF for the past few months. The CDF has attempted to de-escalate the situation by offering refugee status to any members of the ChDKZ who desert it's military regime. They are a militarized insurrection.

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors, Chernarus Defence Force, United States Marine Corps.

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
Civilians are present in the Chernarussian region. **Mission**
Synixe Contractors have been tasked with assisting the CDF in securing POWs deserting from the Chernarussian Movement of the Red Star.

As part of this operation, we will be meeting with a CDF commander who will be giving us a brief by 0830.

The CDF have planned this operation throughout, and as such, it is of utmost importance that we are on time for any of their requests. This is of utmost importance for the safety of everyone involved in the operation. Contractors must treat all POWs with respect and keep them safe, alongside providing them open space to surrender safely.

This is a time-gated operation, make wise use of your time. Contractors are to be at each designated location on time, and must stay within the premises of the AO when not en route to their FOB, additionally, the airspace is restricted to the CDF only. Failure to comply with these requirements is grounds for termination of the contract.

missions.name: Open Road
missions.summary: Contractors ensure the protection and timely delivery of their client's goods.

briefing.old:
**Open Road** **Employer**
Lenny Loggins Company **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Chernarussian Movement of the Red Star (ChDKZ)
The ChDKZ have declared an all out war against all foreign interests in the region, as such, it is highly likely that supply roads and multinational business are being targeted under the current regime.

It is known they have access to multiple soviet-era small arms, alongside surplus DShKMs, BRDMs, and BTRs; these are usually kept to zones of higher influence designated within the area of operations.

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
Civilians are present in the area and are believed to be unsupportive to ChDKZ, thus friendly to contractors.

TERRAIN CONSIDERATIONS:
Extensive mountain ranges and dense forests. **Mission**
Contractors have been hired to provide logistics for the client, ensuring the delivery of three Zamak trucks carrying timber piles to the designated locations marked within the area of operations.

It is known that ChDKZ are operating in the area, mostly around zones of influence marked around in the area of operations; however, it is likely that there are unknown cells operating in other parts of the region, either garrisoning forward positions or being on the lookout for potential targets to ambush. As such, it is best if contractors are to avoid nearing said zones under ChDKZ influence.

Once you arrive at each destination, each truck, alongside with the corresponding cargo, is to be left within the premises.

Additionally, contractors must make sure to see that the workers of the designated settlements are safe and sound upon contractors' arrival and until contractors' departure.

missions.name: Pentest
missions.summary: Contractors attack and destroy the enemy line.

briefing.old:
**Pentest** **Employer**
Ardistan's International Affairs Department **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
CSAT
They are equipped with modern military equipment and will engage on sight to defend the line, they are not to be taken lightly. Mainly infantry deployed at the posts.

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors

INDEPENDENT FORCES:
n/a

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
No civilians present in the area.

TERRAIN CONSIDERATIONS:
Open terrain, base level fog, bad weather conditions. Plan carefully. **Mission**
The Cerberus Regiment division of CSAT has been deployed to hold the border between Takistan and Ardistan in a sovereignty dispute.

Contractors have been hired to assist in attacking the enemy lines, in hopes to push back the militarily occupied border.

Take down the enemy defensive line by any means necessary. Expect heavy contact and continued gunfire.

Contractors are to ensure the border is clear of CSAT presence. All enemy combatants must be either killed or restrained.

missions.name: Personal Matters
missions.summary: Contractors provide services to quell a local insurgency's influence from emerging in the islands of Tanoa.

briefing.old:
**Personal Matters** **Employer**
Horizon Islands Government **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Syndikat
The local insurgency is present at a few keypoints of the area of operations. They are expected to be equipped with small arms and some technicals and are heavily hostile towards Horizon Islands police and other security forces alike.

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Horizon Islands Police

INDEPENDENT FORCES:
N/A

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
Civilians are present in the island and may or may not be aligned with the insurgent's policies.

TERRAIN CONSIDERATIONS:
Heavy jungle, open fields, and bridge crossings. Use them strategically. **Mission**
A tanoan insurgency has been influencing a local movement in one of the islands within the Tanoan province.

Government officials, police, and civilians have been reporting sightings of insurgent forces across the island. Synixe has been provided with somewhat reliable geographical information of where these insurgents most commonly operate. There might be anywhere from one to two areas of enemy presence within each one of the areas of influence.

The insurgents might have gained some of the local's support, which may cause them to be unsupportive, obstructive, or even harmful towards contractors. The insurgency has been stealing food and weapons and reposessing them for their supporters on the island.

Synixe has been contracted to seek out any insurgent forces within the area of operations and either capture or eliminate them.

missions.name: Private Property
missions.summary: Contractors are tasked with securing a high value asset.

briefing.old:
**Private Property** **Employer**
Schnell, by contract from Mark Duncan **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Militarized insurgency
Insurgents are highly aggresive and will resort to smash and grab measures. They will not negotiate.

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
Civilians will be present in nearby towns.

TERRAIN CONSIDERATIONS:
Desert, open area. Plan carefully, set up strategic positions and defenses. **Mission**
We have been contracted to protect private assets owned by Schnell, located West of the town of Cayo.

Schnell is a fuel company which has oiling premises across Sahrani, most notable the one located by Cayo.

It is believed that insurgents may attack this property on this date in order to destabilize local supplies; we are unsure as of yet whether they will be attempting to take over or destroy the assets.

We will be protecting the oil pump fields from insurgent presence should any become apparent. You are to engage enemy presence with aim to kill etiquette.

missions.name: Public Image
missions.summary: Contractors escort and defend an important figure.

briefing.old:
**Public Image** **Employer**
Jamie Ryan, Kujarian henchmen **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
ISAS
The enemy has been known to resort to guerrilla tactics. Their common practises include execution of civilians, interception of humanitarian workers, stealing supplies, and terrorising towns.

They will likely be equipped with no more than surplus weaponry, light anti-tank launchers, and technicals. It is known that they may disguise as civilians in order to carry out attacks.

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors, African Gendarmes

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
Civilians are defenseless against the acts of terrorism ensued by ISAS. Regardless of whether they support us or not, they do not have weapons, and they wish for a better life away from violence and famine.

TERRAIN CONSIDERATIONS:
N/A **Mission**
Contractors have been hired to arrest Hasan Okoye, an important figure of the Kujari region - ID by blue suit. He is expected to be arriving via air at Marwey airfield by 1715.

We are tasked with arresting Okoye, and ensuring he arrives safely at the main villa of Kyari Kinnai. Once there, he is to be left restrained alongside the two businessmen in suits at the main building, within the second floor.

Contractors are not allowed outside of the Area of Operations. Additionally, it has been highly recommended to avoid travelling through the Red Zone, as it is deemed heavily hostile with major enemy presence.

Contractors will maintain security at Kyari Kinnai's villa and fend off any possible attacks until contract expiration time.

No one except for Gendarmerie personnel is allowed entrance to the premises of the villa. Contractors are to prevent anyone to enter uninvited by any means necessary.

Contractors will primarily ensure the villa is safe, and will keep Okoye alive. Secondarily, they shall attempt to keep the two other businessmen alive aswell.

Once contract is completed, Okoye shall be brought back to Synixe's FOB.

missions.name: Redemption
missions.summary: Contact has been lost with an important researcher. Contractors will find out what happened against all odds.

briefing.old:
**Redemption** **Employer**
United Nations **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Takistani Militia
They will engage contractors on sight, and are known to operate in large groups. It is unlikely that they will be using vehicles due to the adverse weather conditions, however, it is known that a large concentration of enemy forces have garrisoned in the city of Zargabad.

FRIENDLY FORCES:
United States Marine Corps

INDEPENDENT FORCES:
n/a

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
Zargabad has been deemed a total warzone for months now, meaning that it will be highly unlikely, but not impossible, to run into civilian presence.

TERRAIN CONSIDERATIONS:
Flat arid desert, heavily urbanized center city, battle-torn theater. **Mission**
Dr. Nikos Manetta's transport helicopter lost contact as he was travelling across Zargabad while he was en route to continuing an important investigation regarding the Takistan conflict. The main area of town has been under dispute for months, turning it into a constant warzone, causing a long lasting and devastating effect on the local populace and infrastructure.

Synixe has been contracted to find out what happened and to attempt to find and rescue Dr. Nikos Manetta, additionally, contractors are invited to act both as offensively and/or defensively as necessary in order to complete the task at hand.

As of writing this, the weather conditions have severely worsened, and we've had to sacrifice our vehicles to receive help in order to infiltrate the area of operations, giving us a head start into town; sounds like we'll be on foot from here.

missions.name: Rooted
missions.summary: Contractors search and rescue.

briefing.old:
**Rooted** **Employer**
Government of Africa **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
ISAS
The enemy has been known to resort to guerrilla tactics. Their common practises include execution of civilians, interception of humanitarian workers, stealing supplies, and terrorising towns.

They will likely be equipped with no more than surplus weaponry, light anti-tank launchers, and technicals.

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors, United Nations

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
Civilians are defenseless against the acts of terrorism ensued by ISAS. Regardless of whether they support us or not, they do not have weapons, and they wish for a better life.

Contractors have been recommended to stick to roads where applicable, in order to avoid disturbing the locals.

TERRAIN CONSIDERATIONS:
N/A **Mission**
The United Nations has been carrying out humanitarian operations in the region of Kujari.

Last week, a team was sent out on a supply run in an attempt to provide locals with water (2x Water Bottle Stacks), as ISAS had caused a siege in unsupporting villages.

We have been tasked with finding this team, and recovering the supplies they were carrying.

The United Nations team was headed to Mandalari, Kabaridi, and Lawan Aridi.

We imagine these could be potential locations of their whereabouts. Additionally, suspicious movements have been reported around Gajaji Mastafa, Kawiya Maloumdi, and Mourimadi.

Find the missing United Nations squad and recover their supplies. Be careful out there.

missions.name: Routine
missions.summary: Contractors assist local forces in maintaining the peace.

briefing.old:
**Routine** **Employer**
Government of Africa **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
ISAS
The enemy has been known to resort to guerrilla tactics. Their common practises include execution of civilians, interception of humanitarian workers, stealing supplies, and terrorising towns.

They will likely be equipped no more than surplus weaponry, light anti-tank launchers, and technicals.

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors, United Nations, African Gendarmes

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
Civilians are defenseless against the acts of terrorism ensued by ISAS. Regardless of whether they support us or not, they do not have weapons, and they wish for a better life.

TERRAIN CONSIDERATIONS:
N/A **Mission**
Contractors have been hired to maintain the peace and security in the town of Marwey.

It is known that ISAS has been attacking local villages, both by stealing supplies, killing and kidnapping villagers, and by carrying out suicide bomb attacks.

You have been tasked with patrolling the main area of the town of Marwey, keeping it's mosque and market areas safe from any dangers until meeting your contract's duration.

Keep your eyes open, check on suspicious activity, maintain security, and restore the peace.

missions.name: Safety
missions.summary: Contractors provide security for local operations.

briefing.old:
**Safety** **Employer**
Government of Africa **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
ISAS
The enemy has been known to resort to guerrilla tactics. Their common practises include execution of civilians, interception of humanitarian workers, stealing supplies, and terrorising towns.

They will likely be equipped no more than surplus weaponry, light anti-tank launchers, and technicals.

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors, United Nations

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
Civilians are defenseless against the acts of terrorism ensued by ISAS. Regardless of whether they support us or not, they do not have weapons, and they wish for a better life.

TERRAIN CONSIDERATIONS:
N/A **Mission**
We have been deployed to establish security over a few key points and operations in the region of Kujari.

It is known that an attack by the hands of ISAS could occur at any moment, making this a very time-sensitive operation, as such, we have been deployed to provide an additional level of safety to local operations.

There are multiple tasks, and some of them have are ways away from eachother. You will have to either choose, cycle, or split up your team as you seem fit in order to complete the operation in the most succesful manner viable.

The town of Barawas has been delivered some supplies by the United Nations, a small group has been stationed there in order to provide security, as this is a very important set of supplies for the villagers' well-being. It has been asked of us to assist in keeping these supplies safe for the local populace.

Mandalari has a scheduled delivery of supplies being carried out by the United Nations at 0800. Ensure this is a safe delivery.

The town Koube Miamatara have reported repeated harassment and attacks by ISAS, additionally, the town of Mimi has had United Nations personnel deployed due to previous incidents.

missions.name: Vultures
missions.summary: Contractors search and destroy enemy supplies.

briefing.old:
**Vultures** **Employer**
Chernarussian National Government **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Chernarussian Movement of the Red Star
Enemies are known to have settled in previously civilian farming settlements out in the country and have been stashing weapons for use in their uprising. They will engage with lethal force on any sighting of an enemy force.

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors, Chernarussian Defence Force

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
Civilians are present in the area and may be for or against our involvement in the region.

TERRAIN CONSIDERATIONS:
Elevation changes, dense forests, and bad weather conditions. **Mission**
There have been reports of a ChDKZ cell setting camp on the northwestern end of the chernarussian region.

We have been informed that they are often seen in and around some of the outer compounds of the area of operations, most of them with large barns and housing structures within - which have been advantengous for the ChDKZ to use as storage sites for their supplies.

Synixe has been contracted to locate any and all enemy force supply caches in the area of operations and to destroy them, alongside with any enemy presence in the area.

Our intelligence reports that they have suspicion of four supply storage sites within the area of operations.

missions.name: Slow and Steady
missions.summary: Synixe is contracted to assist in the disarming of explosives in Suurrsaaiv

briefing.old:
**Slow and Steady** **Employer**
New Suursaariv Government **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Former Suursaariv Military turned Terrorists
Terrorizing New Suursaariv Govt. by planting explosives in construction sites, will likely attempt to stop any and all attempts to assist the new Govt.

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors, New Suursaariv Govt. Militia

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
Majority of Civilians are in support of New Govt. and their activities, with a vocal minority being against. Workers will be near and around work-sites and will continue what work they can.

TERRAIN CONSIDERATIONS:
The island is covered in forest, with the ability to see long distances being restricted. **Mission**
The New Suursaariv Govt. has only recently gotten into power, but already they are making plans to further industrialize the island and expand their export of Lumber. There are terrorists intent on stopping this progress.

A work-site (Mattila) and a main exportation harbor (Lounatrivi) have been found to be mined with military grade Anti-Personnel mines as well as some Improvised-Explosive-Devices. These are to be disarmed and collected. Failing that, markers are to be placed for units that are capable of defusal.

A ruined village (Miettilä) has also been found to have UneXploded Ordnance (UXO). These UXOs are to be disarmed and collected. Failing that, they are to be marked for defusal by capable units later.

When all explosives have been collected/marked, meet with New Suursaariv Govt. Militia (Factory Area) to drop off the explosives for disposal or inform them of the successful markings.

Any and all terrorist activity are to be eliminated.

missions.name: Cleaning House
missions.summary: travel south of the MSR and destroy enemy camps along with any explosives they may have

briefing.old:
**Cleaning House** **Employer**
Takistani Army **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Takistani Militia
Militia has taken total contol of all land south of the MSR. The militia has been known to place IED's along roads to destroy vehicles as well of having patrols throughout the land.

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors, Takistani Army

INDEPENDENT FORCES:
N/A

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
Civilians may act as lookouts but most are neutral on the current gov affairs

TERRAIN CONSIDERATIONS:
**Mission**
Synixe has been hired by the Takistani Army to travel south of the MSR and destroy enemy camps along with any explosives they may have so that they may move in and reclaim the area.

missions.name: Euro Cache
missions.summary: Disrupt the flow of weapons to the Ruhanian liberation front.

briefing.old:
**Euro Cache** **Employer**
Ruha Goverment **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Ruhanian liberation front, Unknown weapons dealers
Ruhanian intelligence has received word that the Ruhanian Liberation Front (RIF) is receiving weapons from an unknown source.

The Ruhanian Liberation Front (RIF) should be considered hostile as they know that the Ruhanian government has hired private contractors to take action against them.

The RIF is well equipped, and most have previous military service/training.

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors, Ruha Military

INDEPENDENT FORCES:
N/A

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
Civilians remain neutral out of fear of reprisal from both sides of the conflict. **Mission**
Synixe has been hired by the Ruhanian goverment to find and disrupt the delivery of weapons to the radical milita group, the Ruhanian Liberation Front (RIF).

missions.name: Caged Bird
missions.summary: Terrorists are planning to retake Zargabad and its airport, Synixe has been tasked with stopping that.

briefing.old:
**Caged Bird** **Employer**
United States Department of Defense **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Local Terrorists
Intelligence gathered from captured Wagner contractors points to an upcoming assault on Zargabad and its airfield by the local terrorist force. They've been provided with APCs by Wagner.

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors, Blue Falcon Company, Yongshi Security Service

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
Civilians have evacuated the city due to the local terrorists taking over the city.

TERRAIN CONSIDERATIONS:
Outside of Zargabad it is mostly flat terrain but the city itself is heavily urban, windows and alleys are of chief concern. **Mission**
The debriefing of the Wagner contractors have led to the information that the local terrorists will be assaulting PMC positions within and around Zargabad early in the morning. They will be under the direction of Wagner advisors in a Command Post within or nearby Zargabad.

Blue Falcon Company has set up a hasty defense at the airfield, and Yonshi Security Service have set up a defense and patrol in the village of Yarum.

Blue Falcon Company is in charge of keeping the Airfield in friendly hands. Yongshi Security Service's responsibility is to contain the fighting within Zargabad.

Synixe's objective is to clear Zargabad of enemy forces as well as find the Wagner Command Post.

missions.name: Get Stuck In
missions.summary: Marines have been ambushed and separated in Zargabad, Synixe has been contracted to rescue/recover these Marines.

briefing.old:
**Get Stuck In** **Employer**
United States Department of Defense **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Local Terrorists
Terrorists have already used roadside IEDs as well as ambush tactics. More IEDs are to be expected. They will likely stop any attempts to rescue/recover Marines.

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors, United States Marine Corps

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
Civilians have been evacuated for the most part due to the heavy fighting.

TERRAIN CONSIDERATIONS:
Outside of Zargabad it is mostly flat terrain but the city itself is heavily urban, windows and alleys are of chief concern. **Mission**
A Marine convoy has been ambushed en route to Zargabad. A Marine Force Recon unit was tasked with clearing a route through Zargabad in their place but have come under heavy fire and have become seperated.

BluFor Trackers have indicated that their unit has been separated into 3 pieces. They're indicated to be at the following GridCoords/Location: 042040, 038040, and The Villa.

The Force Recon unit, at their time of tasking, was 13 men strong. The objective is recover the dead and provide relief to the living.

Bodybags for the Force Recon dead will be provided at the location of the initial ambush. The ambulance has been parked nearby and will also serve as the location for the bodies to be left.

missions.name: Hired Help
missions.summary: Several PMC's have been hired to secure Zargabad and its surroundings, Synixe has been tasked with taking Zargabad itself.

briefing.old:
**Hired Help** **Employer**
United States Department of Defense **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Local Terrorists
They've taken control of the city with the help of Wagner forces and are likely to have fortified their defenses. IED's, roadblocks and static weapons are to be expected.

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors, Blue Falcon Company, Yongshi Security Service

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
Civilians have evacuated the city due to the local terrorists taking over the city.

TERRAIN CONSIDERATIONS:
Outside of Zargabad it is mostly flat terrain but the city itself is heavily urban, windows and alleys are of chief concern. **Mission**
Zargabad has been deemed a point of interest by the D.O.D. While the marines have already pushed through, the city still needs to be secured for access to its airfield.

Two other PMC's have also been hired for this task. Yongshi Security Service has cleared and is holding the town located at the GridCoord 040035. Blue Falcon Company is holding a security checkpoint at at the GridCoord 038027.

It is advised that Synixe contractors familiarize themselves with the other PMC's present at Zarghabad to avoid friendly fire incidents.

Synixe's objective is to clear Zargabad of any and all enemy forces.

missions.name: Housekeeping
missions.summary: Contact with the Blue Falcon Company security team has been lost, Synixe is being sent in to check in on them.

briefing.old:
**Housekeeping** **Employer**
Blue Falcon Company **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Possible Insurgents
There have been a few clashes between the Insurgents and local Army. The insurgents seem to have access to armored-up technicals. They may be involved with the unaccounted for Blue Falcon security team.

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors, Blue Falcon Company

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
It is early in the morning, civilians are likely to be still at home. **Mission**
Blue Falcon Company is very impressed with Synixe's ability to troubleshoot particular problems, and have contracted Synixe to investigate a possible issue.

A VIP is being accompanied by a Blue Falcon Company security team in Southern Sahrani at a town called Arcadia. They are currently residing in the hotel near the center of town.

The security team hasn't responded to the hourly check-in and Blue Falcon Company has their hands full with pulling security for the Airport.

Synixe is being contracted to go find out what happened, and if the worse has come to pass to bring the VIP back to Synixe's FOB for transfer to Blue Falcon Company custody at another time.

missions.name: Wake-Up Call
missions.summary: Red Star cells are consolidating, Synixe is to stir up distrust amongst them.

briefing.old:
**Wake-Up Call** **Employer**
United States Department of Defense **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Red Star
Supplied with gear from Russia, they have been launching assaults on local forces and causing general chaos. They are decently armed and make heavy use of technicals.

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors **Mission**
Red Star has been growing, with many individual cells now moving to cooperate in future terrorist operations.

One such cooperation has been found in a relatively abandoned part of the countryside, with a rather built up outpost.

Synixe will be supplied with weapons and vehicles often found in Red Star hands. These weapons and vehicles are to be openly used in the assault of the Red Star outpost, in order to convince the occupants that that they are under attack by a fellow cell.

The assault will take place early in the morning to better add to the confusion. This will hopefully sow distrust amongst the cells, and delay them from working together again.

The main objective is to destroy the outpost's resources and to leave no trace that an outside party took part in the conflict.

missions.name: Wanna Fly
missions.summary: Synixe is contracted to retake a Airbase West of Suurrsaaiv

briefing.old:
**Wanna Fly** **Employer**
New Suursaariv Government **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
PMC Wagner
Working in Russian interest to regain control of the island, they've garrisoned the once abandoned Airbase in an effort to exert power of the New Government.

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
The Airbase and its island was long abandoned, no civilians will be present.

TERRAIN CONSIDERATIONS:
Half of the island is covered in forest, with the other being cut down to make room for the Airbase and airstrip. **Mission**
The New Suursaariv Govt. is still working to make themselves fully independent, but are now being strong-armed by PMC Wagner's presence on the nearby Airbase.

The island of Säyvö is West of the main land, and has been abandoned since Suursaariv's initial independence. Wagner has garrisoned the base once more and Govt. forces have reported seeing a couple of airframes arriving on the island, including a fast-mover.

The Airbase is to be cleared out of any and all enemy forces. Any airframes are to be disposed of, and the Airbase to be rendered useless to deter any future attempts of garrisoning it by enemy forces.

missions.name: Ain't No Mountain High Enough
missions.summary: Contractors rescue a village leader

briefing.old:
**Ain't No Mountain High Enough** **Employer**
British Armed Forces, IDAP **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Takistani Militia
Attack Contractors on sight. They are staged to the west of the village.

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors, British Armed Forces

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
Civilian pressence is expected, as well as an IDAP camp mounted in the village.

TERRAIN CONSIDERATIONS:
The terrain in the AO is mountainous. **Mission**
Tensions are high in the Takistan Mountains as the British Armed Forces have been helping IDAP with humanitarian missions, which the Takistani militia sees as a threat.

Yesterday an attack occured on a village which is currently home to an IDAP aid camp. The Takistani milita had been amassing to the West of the village but were not percieved as a threat. In the attack aside from opening fire on civilians they abducted the village elder. It is believed that he will be used as a bargaining chip to get the British to leave the area.

The British have hired Synixe to move into enemy territory and gather information to find where the elder is and bring him back home if possible. IDAP has also asked us to deliver some supplies to their aid camp in the village.

British Armed Forces have set up a checkpoint between the enemy territory and the village. They have notified us that there is a stretch of road that is mined, which IDAP is planning to clear with an UGV. If Synixe were to clear it it would certainly help improve our reputation.

missions.name: Ain't No Rest For The Wicked
missions.summary: Contractors recover stolen trucks

briefing.old:
**Ain't No Rest For The Wicked** **Employer**
Tanoan Government, NATO **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Unknown
Unknown

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
Civilian pressence is expected in the towns

TERRAIN CONSIDERATIONS:
Terrain in Tanoa is riddled with jungles. **Mission**
Recently an ION convoy with three Daltgreen trucks carrying Uranium-235 was ambushed. The convoy was headed to the La Rochelle docks to load the trucks onto a NATO boat so that the Uranium was transported to allied countries. To avoid a gloabal crisis NATO and the Tanoan government have hired Synixe to recover the trucks.

We know were the convoy was ambushed, we are tasked with investiganting the remains and finding out where the trucks are. Once we find them we are to take them to where they were originally headed and load them onto the ship that is going to take them out of the country.

You are authorized to establish contact with any surviors or nearby civlians to gather clues.

missions.name: Economy of Death
missions.summary: Contractors are tasked with destroying stolen weaponry

briefing.old:
**Economy of Death** **Employer**
D.O.D (Department of Defense) **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Chernarussian Movement of the Red Star
Enemies will defend what they've stolen

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors


CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
No civilian pressence in the AO

TERRAIN CONSIDERATIONS:
The AO has a thick forest **Mission**
A shipment of US weapons that was being transported to a country that's at war with Russia via train was ambushed. Unkown forces derailed the train and handed the weapons off to Chedaki insurgents who have now scattered them across the countryside.

The shipment consisted of:
-Two AN/MPQ-105 Radars
-Two MIM-145 Defender AA batteries
-Three UGV stompers, two of them being armed
-Two Mini-Spike launchers of the AA variety
-Two Mini-Spike launchers of the AT variety
-Two XM312 machine guns

Contractors are tasked with destroying the weapons so that no traces of US involvement are left

missions.name: Flight of Icarus
missions.summary: Contractors save the passangers of a crashed helicopter

briefing.old:
**Flight of Icarus** **Employer**
Director boards of several companies. **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Unknown

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors, Theseus Inc

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
Aside from the pressence of the VIPs, civilian pressence is expected in towns

TERRAIN CONSIDERATIONS:
Terrain in the AO is hilly and covered by forests **Mission**
Two hours ago a helicopter carrying several businessmen and CEOs from different companies crashed while flying over Altis. It is unknown what caused the crashed but it is assumed that it was due to fowl weather conditions.

Synixe has been hired by the boards of the companies to which the men belong to act as a rescue force. We are tasked with finding the wreck and brigning any survivors back to our F.O.B. Theseus Inc was hired to provide bodyguards for the passengers and they have also asked us to bring their people back.

Should any of the VIPs die we must retrieve their bodies and bring them back to our F.O.B as well.

We have been provided with the passenger log of the helicopter in order to properly identify everyone.

missions.name: Garbageman
missions.summary: Contractors recover stolen NATO gear

briefing.old:
**Garbageman** **Employer**
NATO **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Takistani Militia
AMLCOA: Protect the stolen gear.

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
There is active civilian populace in the AO.

TERRAIN CONSIDERATIONS:
The terrain in the AO is mountainous. **Mission**
Two days ago a NATO convoy was ambushed by the Takistani Militia, this ambush resulted in the deaths of ten soldiers and the theft of a bunch of NATO supplies and gear.

NATO has hired Syinxe to track down the stolen items and recover them. The items are: three crates of basic weapons, two crates of grenades, two crates of launchers and an M-ATV HMG variant.

missions.name: Glitter & Gold
missions.summary: Contractors recover stolen trucks

briefing.old:
**Glitter & Gold** **Employer**
The Pan-Global Corporation **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Chernarussian Movement of the Red Star
Protect what they've stolen

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
Civilian pressence expected in towns.

TERRAIN CONSIDERATIONS:
Outside of cities Chernarus is mainly covered by forests. **Mission**
Recently four trucks loaded with gold ore were stolen from a mine owned by The Pan-Global Corporation.

HUMINT has revealed that the people responsible for the theft are the Chernarussian Movement of the Red Star and that they plan to sell the trucks to fund their operations.

Chedakis have been spotted at the Balota airfield, so Pan-Global has hired Synixe to go to the airifield and recover all four trucks.

Once the trucks have been acquired they are to be dropped off at the docks south of Komarovo, where a Pan-Global sensitive cargo recovery team is waiting to take them to a secure location.

missions.name: Here Comes the Hotstepper
missions.summary: Contractors search for and rescue captured workers

briefing.old:
**Here Comes the Hotstepper** **Employer**
Oil company operating out of Shapur **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Armed Forces of the Russian Federation
AMLCOA: Defend the territory they've taken

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
The only civilians present in the AO are the captured workers

TERRAIN CONSIDERATIONS:
The terrain in Shapur if mostly flat. **Mission**
Recently the Armed Forces of the Russia Federation moved in and took over the territory of Shapur e-Dalanper, capturing the workers of the oil company established there and displacing the civilians that lived in the area.

Synixe has been hired to move into the area and find and rescue the team of 16 workers and the COO of the oil company who was overseeing operations.

missions.name: Hit the Road Vlad
missions.summary: Contractors lay the ground work for an invasion

briefing.old:
**Hit the Road Vlad** **Employer**
Chernarussian Government **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Russian Armed Forces
Defend the areas they have taken control of

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
Civilians have already been evacuated from the island

TERRAIN CONSIDERATIONS:
N/A **Mission**
Recently the Russian Armed Forces moved into Utes, killing Chernarussian forces stationed there and taking control of the island.

Synixe has been hired to lay the ground work for a Chernarussian retaking of the island. We are tasked with destroying key infrastructure that would aid the russians in defending their positions.

Contractors are to destroy:
- A radar and radio tower
- AA weaponry
- An ammo cache
- A fuel supply
- A transmitter tower
- Any vehicles that may give the Russians air superiority

We have been provided with aerial photos of the island as well as Stingers by the Chernarussians.

missions.name: Living In The Shadows
missions.summary: Contractors locate a research facility that has gone dark

briefing.old:
**Living In The Shadows** **Employer**
Pan-Chem, a subsidiary of the Pan-Global corporation **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Unknown
Unknown

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
N/A

TERRAIN CONSIDERATIONS:
The AO is covered by a thick jungle **Mission**
Recently Synixe intercepted a distress signal from a facility deep in the Tanoan jungle belonging to the Pan-Chem corporation.

Apparently something happened at the facility and the Pan-Chem corporation is willing to pay anyone who can get to the facility and extract any sensitive data that may remain there.

It is unknown what was being investigated at the facility and the exact location of it.

missions.name: Misery Business
missions.summary: Contractros gather evidence on a company's illicit dealings

briefing.old:
**Misery Business** **Employer**
Interpol, NATO **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
CSAT, Company Security Forces.
AMLCOA: Attack contracotrs on sight if spotted. CSAT reinforcements are expected once contractors engage company forces.

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
Civilian pressence expected in the island

TERRAIN CONSIDERATIONS:
Terrain on the island is mostly flat. **Mission**
A months long Interpol investigation in cooperation with NATO has revealed that a company headquartered in Porto is being used as a CSAT front for all kinds of illicit dealings.

Contractors have been hired by Interpol and NATO to break into the company's headquarters and gather evidence on their illicit dealings.

Illegal or CSAT related items work, but copies of sensitive documents are preferred over other types of evidence. For the contract to be successful contractors must find irrefutable proof of the company dealing secretly with CSAT. Contractors are to take note of what these documents say but not outright take them as that would tip CSAT off as to why the operation took place. Contractors are also to take some valuables with them back to base, in order to cover up the reason on why they attacked the company.

Keep in mind that after contractors are spotted a CSAT response team is expected to arrive on the island.

missions.name: My Kingdom
missions.summary: Contractors capture a prime minister

briefing.old:
**My Kingdom** **Employer**
Southern Sahrani Government **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Sahrani Liberation Army
Attack contractors on sight. They have a wide array of vehicles both medium and light armored at their disposal.

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors, Royal Army Corps of Sahrani

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
No Civilian pressence in the AO

TERRAIN CONSIDERATIONS:
Terrain in the AO is mountainous an has some scattered forests. **Mission**
A civil war is raging in Sahrani, Loyalists on the south wanting to take over the northern territories from the Ultranationalists that govern it and viceversa.

We've been hired by the Southern government (who is on NATO's good graces) to attack the city of Bagango where Juan Ramirez, the prime minister who leads the northern forces, resides. We are to apprehend Ramirez and deliver him to the miltary base in the Paraiso airport.

We'll be parachuting into the AO as it's the safest way to infiltrate it. Load up the gear you can't carry into the supply crates and grab a parachute from the box. Once everyone is ready have the Operation Lead speak with the officer in charge to get things moving. Once over the jump area the pilot will yell Jump.

The gear in the supply crates will be waiting at a previously specified drop off point. We've also been provided with two vehicle dead drops to make our return trip easier. One of boats near the enemy occupied town of Mercalillo and another one of Land Rovers near Rashidah.

DO NOT ATTEMPT TO CROSS THROUGH CORAZOL, it's where the heaviest fighting is going on and heavy enemy troops are most likely surrounding it.

missions.name: Something In The Way
missions.summary: Contractors investigate a shipwreck

briefing.old:
**Something In The Way** **Employer**
Kingdom of Sahrani **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Looters
They are most likely going to be salvaging the ship and protecting anything they may have stolen.

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
Some survivors from the wreckage are expected.

TERRAIN CONSIDERATIONS:
N/A **Mission**
Recently a ship that was meant to dock in Corazol has wrecked in the Abra de Boca. The Kingdom of Sahrani has hired Synixe to investigate the wreckage and locate the containers the ship was carrying along with the crew.

Should contractors find any of the containers they should tag them with a circle and drop a HI Yellow chemlight. If any survivors are found they should be brought back to the Corazol docks.

It is expected that looters will be at the site of the wreckage and they may have already ran off with some of the containers.

Contractors have been provided with diving equipment in order to properly investigate the wreckage as well as underwater rifles just in case.

missions.name: Symphony of Destruction
missions.summary: Contractors find chemical sources

briefing.old:
**Symphony of Destruction** **Employer**
Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Local insurgents
Attack any forces on sight

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors, CIA recovery team

INDEPENDENT FORCES:
Livonian Defense Force

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
Civilians are expected outside of the quarantined area.

TERRAIN CONSIDERATIONS:
Terrain in the AO is covered by forests and can be mountainous in certain parts. **Mission**
Recently during a private research endeavor a chemical detector started going off when approaching an area in the South Western corner of the AO. Upon further investigation it was revealed that the measurements from the detector align with those of chemical weapons.

The CIA has gotten wind of this and has hired Synixe to venture into the area where the signals were detected and recover any and all causes of these signals. Once they are recovered they are to be taken to a drop off site where a CIA helicopter is awaiting to get them off the country.

CIA has gotten in contact with the neighboring LDF and has had them quarantine the area, so no civilians are expected in the location where the signals are coming from. They've also managed to provide us with Chemical Detectors which are not as strong as the ones that were first used to detect the signals, but should still go off when within 100 meters of the source. They've also given us gas masks, they don't think there should be any risk of contractors dying from these sources so the decision to wear them is up to the contractor.

missions.name: The Trooper
missions.summary: Contractors track down an MIA LRRP

briefing.old:
**The Trooper** **Employer**
Department of Defense (D.O.D) **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Takistani Army
AMLCOA: Attack anyone who's on their territory on sight

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors, US Army

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
N/A

TERRAIN CONSIDERATIONS:
The terrain on the takistani side is hilly with thick vegetation on some parts **Mission**
Recently an LRRP that was sent to scout an oil pumping facility under Takistani control has gone MIA. The patrol consists of four delta team operators who were being accompanied by an army officer.

Contractors have been tasked with brining all of the members of the patrol back, wether they are dead or alive. It is suggested they start by investigating the pumping facility.

The US army holds one side of the region while the Takistanis have set themselves up on the other one.

missions.name: Wanna Be Startin' Somethin'
missions.summary: Contractors track down FIA weapon caches

briefing.old:
**Wanna Be Startin' Somethin'** **Employer**
Altian Government **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Freedom and Independence Army (FIA)
AMLCOA: Hide and protect the caches.

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors

INDEPENDENT FORCES:
AAF

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
N/A

TERRAIN CONSIDERATIONS:
The terrain in the AO is mostly composed of mountains and forests **Mission**
An AAF intel gathering operation found that the FIA has been planning an assault on the town of Oreokastro. The Government has evacuated the civilians from the town and has stationed some AAF troops there.

Since the town is already undermanned the Government has contracted Synixe to find the weapon caches the FIA are planning to use to assault the town and destroy them.

The intel the AAF has gathered says that there are six caches in the area around Oreokastro.

missions.name: Who's Ready For Tomorrow
missions.summary: Contractors track down a hacker

briefing.old:
**Who's Ready For Tomorrow** **Employer**
Central Intelligence Agency (C.I.A) **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Takistani militia
It is believed they've been working with the hacker themselves and that they'll protect him.

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors


CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
No civilan pressence in the AO

TERRAIN CONSIDERATIONS:
N/A **Mission**
A month ago a CIA black site was wiped out. The takistani militia took credit for the attack and claimed that more would come.

After gathering information and doing surveillance the CIA found out that the Takistanis have been working with a hacker in order to learn about american positions in the region.

Contractors have been hired to apprehend the hacker and extract him out of the region.

Through tracking a series of keystrokes the CIA has learned that the militia has been mainting contact with the hacker mainly from the town of Abad

missions.name: Asset At Risk
missions.summary: Contractors grab burnt double informant

briefing.old:
**Asset At Risk** **Employer**
U.S. Department of Defense **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Warlord Forces
AMLCOA: Move mostly on bike and on foot due to rocky, mountainous terrain.

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors, Armed Forces of Kushan

INDEPENDENT FORCES:
N/A

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
Present in all towns, many don't like the U.S. and local warlords forces.

TERRAIN CONSIDERATIONS:
Mountainous terrain with lots of trees and large rocks, provides lots of concealment and cover. Infil by land deemed both impractical and impossible. **Mission**
While Hezbollah-e-Kushan is not present in the AO, as their forces are being held back in the southern part of Kushan with the introduction of Coalition forces into the region, a local warlord (Abbas Khalili) and his men have been gaining power in the mountainous, northern regions of Kushan. Due to Kushan Forces and sparse Coalition forces being mainly focused on the South, the situation quickly grew out of hand. The CIA has focused part of their attention on the warlord's forces in an attempt to keep the region stable, which has included the use of informants and insiders into the group.

One informant (Jabr Anwari) has given the CIA many leads into the innerworkings of the group, although many of his physical leads being mixed bags. Upon further analysis, other insiders have reported this informant working with the Warlord to ambush and attack Kushanate Forces and Ground Branch teams working in the area. However, the informant has suddenly requested that he be brought out of the country in return for major information on the Warlord's location. It seems that the Warlord's forces were unaware that the informant was working with the United States, leading to the Warlord putting a large bounty on his head.

With Synixe contractors already in the area, we have been hired by the CIA to secure the informant and bring him to the outpost in Ben Geurrir.

Due to the make and distance of the terrain, the CIA will provide transport into the AO to a pre-designated LZ a kilometer away from the town of Oum Ali (where the informant is located). Once at the outpost, the helicopter will return to bring the contractors and the informant back to the airfield. While the helicopter shouldn't take too long to arrive, it's best to make sure the LZ, at the Ben Guerrir Outpost, is safe before sending for pick-up.

missions.name: Back To The Basics
missions.summary: Contractors remove AA threats and deliver needed supplies

briefing.old:
**Back To The Basics** **Employer**
IDAP and the Tanoan Government **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Syndikat
AMLCOA: Although made up mostly of amateur bandits, will ambush contractors using explosives and heavy weapons.

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors, Gendarmerie

INDEPENDENT FORCES:
N/A

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
Civilians present in every populated area

TERRAIN CONSIDERATIONS:
Most of the surface area of Tanoa is taken up by jungles, exception being in cities, towns, villages, and roads. **Mission**
Because of a recent famine, Syndikat has been overtly attacking government officials and Gendarmerie, trying to gain power on Tanoa. These attacks spread to IDAP convoys and workers once the NGO started their work on the island, trying to bring food, water, and medical aid to the populace.

In a last bid to control the IDAP supplies coming to the island, Syndikat decided to lock down the two airports on the main Tanoan Island using multiple AA emplacements, which is where both IDAP and the Tanoan Government decided to hire Contractors to clear the AA threat to the southern Tanoan Airport and protect and deliver IDAP supplies to 3 locations: The IDAP Base Camp, and two Aid Stations in Georgetown and Tanouka.

The supplies that contractors have been hired to protect consist of food, water, medical, and equipment boxes. While the food and water will need to be delivered to each IDAP location specified, the medical supplies and equipment will only need to be delivered to the IDAP Base Camp. However, while the food and water boxes were able to be safely delivered to the Saint-George Airport, the helicopter that was dropping the medical supplies and equipment was forced to make an emergency landing at the Bala Airstrip after taking heavy fire from Syndikat forces.

As for the AA sites, the Gendarmerie have narrowed the locations of each confirmed AA site to the corresponding areas on the map (Red Circles). There should be no AA expected outside these areas.

missions.name: House Visit
missions.summary: Contractors assault town to capture or kill a takistani bombmaker

briefing.old:
**House Visit** **Employer**
Kingdom of Kushan **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Hezbollah-e-Kushan: Splinter of the Syrian Hezbollah, although no longer allied. Group usually favors engaging with heavy weapons (mainly surplus M2s), while lacking traditional armored vehicles. Their fighters mainly dress in surplus M81 and MARPAT, and have a universal use of plate carriers. Declared themselves enemies of NATO and Kushan forces during the 2008 security crisis, fighters will shoot contractors on sight.

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors, Armed Forces of Kushan

TERRAIN CONSIDERATIONS:
Civilians are present within the region, this is also true for the town of Gotepe. **Mission**
With Kushan Soldiers pushing back Hezbollah-e-Kushan fighters to the southern region of the country during a recent military operation, it was rumored that months ago the fighters brought in an experienced bombmaker from Takistan. 3 months after this rumor surfaced, the number of lethal ambushes against Kushan Forces started with IEDs and other explosives nearly tripled. With the massive uptick in IEDs being used against Kushan Forces, the fighting in region of Gunkizli (among many others in the country) has come to a standstill as Kushan Forces struggled to gain the momentum needed to continue their push.

Recent information given to Kushan Army Command, sourced from British Intelligence, cited that the bombmaker (Khalil Yousuf) was present in the region in the town of Goztepe. This town is noted to be heavily defended by Hezbollah-e-Kushan fighters as it is important staging area for their attacks against Kushan Forces, but it is also staggerlingly close to BluFor's area of control. Kushan Forces took the opportunity to eliminate the bombmaker, but their attempts fell short due to their forces being ill-equipped to deal with explosives, keeping them from being able to reach the town while taking major casualties in the process.

Instead, Contractors have been hired to find the bombmaker, and bring him back to the Kushan Garrison at the Airfield they (the Contractors) were flown in, dead or alive.

missions.name: Key Access
missions.summary: Contractors assist NSM in capturing key road.

briefing.old:
**Key Access** **Employer**
Kingdom of Sahrani **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
Sahrani Revolutionary Army
Modernized remnants of the SLA that control most of the northern island of Sahrani. Utilize older generation Soviet and Russian Armor, while much of their infantry use updated equipment.

FRIENDLY FORCES:
Synixe Contractors, Northern Sahrani Monarchists

INDEPENDENT FORCES:
N/A

CIVILIAN CONSIDERATIONS:
All civilians have been evactuated from Obregan as soon as the fighting escalated when the NSM starting controlling cities.

TERRAIN CONSIDERATIONS:
Obregan is flat, but surrounded by mountainous terrain to the west. **Mission**
After the failure of the 2029 COIN operations in Northern Sahrani, the remnants of the SLA (now the SRA) fell under united leadership, leading to the eventual fall of Corozal and Bagango in 2032. Under the threat of SRA forces bringing the fight into South Sahrani, the Kingdom of Sahrani agreed to sign a ceasefire and later a peace accord, bringing the island into a tense situation.

As RACS forces pulled out of the northern island, paramilitary fighters (known now as the North Sahrani Monarchists) took up arms against the SRA, both sides receiving equipment and training from their respective sponsors.

After years of fighting, the Northern Sahrani Conflict has finally reached it's flash point, NSM forces had successfully captured Corazol and most of the towns to east. With easy access to support from the RACS, NSM forces set their sights on Bagango, and the eventual recapture of the entire island.

Refusing to break the peace accord so early, the Kingdom of Sahrani has hired Contractors to assist the NSM in capturing the town of Obregan so that an assault force can move through and attempt to capture Bagango.

missions.name: Priority Delivery
missions.summary: Contractors deliver weaponry to Takistani Army Bases in the AO.

briefing.old:
**Priority Delivery** **Employer**
Takistani Government **Situation**
ENEMY FORCES:
